h2. Recent space activity macros (Russian language) has incorrect russian phrase.

If the participant has changed or created a page, the following will be written in Russian in "Recent space activity" macros 
"<Page Name> поспособствовало вчера в 2:27 PM" (eng: "<Page Name> contributed yesterday at 2: 27 PM")
The word "поспособствовало" in this context is *extremely inappropriate* and violates the norms of the Russian language.

Good synonyms can be:
- "принял участие" - when creating and editing the page; unfortunately only applicable for male employees. For the female gender, you must write "приняла участие".
"<Page Name> принял участие вчера в 2:27 PM"
"<Page Name> приняла участие вчера в 2:27 PM"
or
"<Page Name> принял(-а) участие вчера в 2:27 PM" - this is also correct for both genders, but is considered too simple for such a respected system

It is more correct to write:
"создал" - when creating a page (masculine) and "создала" for feminine
"изменил" - when changing the page (male gender) and "изменила" for female gender

In Russian, it is appropriate to sometimes omit verbs, this is exactly the case:
"<Page Name>, вчера в 2:27 PM" - this is a great option for both male and female gender and other genera, if available, and exactly meets the standards of the Russian language
fields.summary: Incorrect russian phrase

fields.description:
h2. Issue Background

The Trello Ecosystem team is building a Trello Power-up that would provide a better user experience for Confluence users with Trello. One of the power-up features is the attachments section that lists the Confluence links in a friendly manner, showing some basic data, like the page name, creation date, author name, along with the thumbnail image for the pages that have image attachments. 

!Screen Shot 2020-09-02 at 10.44.44 PM.png!

To fetch data from Confluence, our app implements the 3LO authorization flow. So, once authorized, using the access token we make the API requests via the `https://api.atlassian.com/ex/confluence/\{cloudid}/\{api}` endpoint.

The images URLs we use for thumbnails, are the attachments download URLs, and this doesn't work well in a couple of cases. (Not working in Safari, and doesn't work if the browser doesn't hold the authentication cookies to that specific confluence site, where the image belongs to.)

A much more reliable approach would be using the confluence-files API to fetch data about page attachments, so we can get direct image URLs.
h2. Problem

Using confluence-files API works fine via `api.atlassian.com`, even without any access tokens, only if we request data for unrestricted pages (publicly visible, that do not need site authorization).

Example: [https://api.atlassian.com/ex/confluence/fff89a1a-52c8-11e5-91b2-3c15c2bd8caa-ecosystem/rest/files/1.0/files/content/431882386]

Fo the restricted spaces, if we don't apply authorization, we get the 403 error, which is fine. However, as it turns out, the `wiki/rest/files` endpoints are not supported through OAuth 2.0 (3LO). So if we apply the same authorization flow to this endpoint, we get the 401 error.

Example: [https://api.atlassian.com/ex/confluence/a436116f-02ce-4520-8fbb-7301462a1674/rest/files/1.0/files/content/795320709]

Adding 3LO support for the `wiki/rest/files` endpoints would allow external apps to have a much better content experience.
fields.summary: Add OAuth 2.0 (3LO) support for confluence-files API (wiki/rest/files)

fields.description:
Given reduced retention periods for Organisational and product audit logs to days as opposed to months/years, it's often an organisations requirement to extract logs into a SIEM or log aggregation tool to fulfill retention requirements.

The method to extract with Atlassian Cloud differs from Organisation and Product Tools.

Organisation audit logs can be extracted with API tokens that have granted full admin privileges with conflicts with least privilege policies. However at least these are centrally maintained.

For Jira Cloud and Confluence cloud, the API tokens used to extract these Audit logs is based on an explicit users permission, so other admins can see/manage them. 

If these were managed centrally so any admin can manage them, rather than linked to a user that may leave would be an improvement.

A work around of creating a specific user to generate this API token becomes complex with SSO and MFA enabled. This also consumes a valuable product licence.

 

Improvement in the consistent / centralisation of audit logs to Organisation would be ultimate suggestion, at the least to allow ability to create audit log API token not tied to a user would be next best solution.
fields.summary: API Audit Logs extraction Improvements to centralised Token Management

h3. Issue Summary

When OR operator is used on the title field with the tilde fuzzy match operator, results are not returned from both clauses. If one clause is exact match =, then the results will be from the title= search. If both clauses are ~, results will be returned from the first clause. 

When I run [https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/search?cql=title%20~%20test] I get a totalSize of 142
 When I run [https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/search?cql=title%20=%20new] I get a totalSize of 39
 When I run booth in the same query [https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/search?cql=title%20~%20test%20or%20title%20=%20new] I get a totalSize 25 Shouldn’t be more than 142? Looks like it have something to do with the use of ~
